com.fxgraph.graph

Class MultiplotModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fxgraph.graph.Model
      • com.fxgraph.graph.MultiplotModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MultiplotModel
extends Model
    A model containing cells and edges in a manner specialized for storing multiple datasets/plots of 2d coordinate points (cells) and their connections (edges).
    Since:
    17 August 2021
    Author:
    ogallagher
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • plots

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.List<CartesianPoint>> plots
        Map of plots, each plot having a name for quick reference and a list of CartesianPoints.

      • plotDefault

        private java.lang.String plotDefault
        Default plot to use if a plot name is not specified. Set to reference the first plot created.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        In addition to clearing general model cell and edge references, clear plots as well.
        Overrides:

      • getPlotsCount

        public int getPlotsCount()
        Returns:
        Number of plots.

      • getPlotDefault

        public java.lang.String getPlotDefault()
        Returns:
        The default plot name, or null if no plots exist.

      • setPlotDefault

        public void setPlotDefault(java.lang.String plotName)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the default plot name.
        Parameters:
        plotName - Name string referencing the default plot.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If plotName is not yet in this model.

      • addPlot

        public void addPlot(java.lang.String name,
                    java.util.Collection<javafx.geometry.Point2D> dataset)
        Convert a dataset of raw points to CartesianPoint plots and add to this graph. If there is already a plot of the given name, the previous plot is replaced with the new one.
        Parameters:
        name - Plot name.
        dataset - Plot points.

      • addPoint

        public CartesianPoint addPoint(java.lang.String plotName,
                               javafx.geometry.Point2D point)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a point to the given plot. If the plot name doesn't yet exist, create a new plot.

        Edges to connect new points in the plot are not created, and must be added explicitly.
        Parameters:
        plotName - Name of the plot to add the point to.
        point - The coordinates of the new point.
        Returns:
        A reference to the added point.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If there is already a point in the given plot with the same x value.

      • addCell

        public void addCell(ICell cell)
             throws java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Use #addPoint(String, Point2D, boolean) instead.
        Overrides:
        addCell in class Model
        Parameters:
        cell - The cell to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Not allowed to attempt adding a cell that is not a point in a plot.

      • removeCell

        public void removeCell(ICell cell)
        Remove a cell from the model. If the cell is not found in the model, this method does nothing.
        Overrides:
        removeCell in class Model
        Parameters:
        cell - The cell to remove.

      • addEdge

        public SimpleEdge addEdge(CartesianPoint sourcePoint)
        Create a SimpleEdge between the source point and the next point in its plot. If the source point is the last one, then no edge is added.

        The source point must already be linked to the target to determine the next point with CartesianPoint.getNext().
        Parameters:
        sourcePoint - The point from which the edge starts.
        Returns:
        The added edge, or null if sourcePoint is the last in its plot.

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(ICell sourceCell,
                    ICell targetCell)
        Deprecated. This method is slower and more prone to error than addEdge(CartesianPoint).
        Convenience method for addEdge(IEdge), adding a SimpleEdge instance between two CartesianPoint cells.
        Overrides:
        addEdge in class Model
        Parameters:
        sourceCell - The edge source cell.
        targetCell - The edge target cell.
        See Also:
        addEdge(IEdge)

      • addEdge

        public void addEdge(IEdge edge)
             throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Deprecated. This method is slower and more prone to error than addEdge(CartesianPoint).
        Adds an edge to the model, ensuring that it is not null, and that it connects two adjacent CartesianPoint cells that belong to the same plot.

        Ultimately calls addEdge(CartesianPoint) once method parameters have been validated.
        Overrides:
        addEdge in class Model
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If edge == null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the source or target cell is not a CartesianPoint, or if they are not valid sequential points.

      • attachOrphansToGraphParent

        public void attachOrphansToGraphParent(java.util.List<ICell> cellList)
        Prevents default model behavior to allow orphan cells (cells that have no parent). The first point in a plot has no parent, and the last point has no child.
        Overrides:
        attachOrphansToGraphParent in class Model
